solution.text:
First to obtain \(_{j}_x^3\) we multiply the divisor\((x^2+2x+1)\) by _{j}_x
secondly to obtain \(_{k}_x^2\) we multiply the divisor\((x^2+2x+1)\) by _{k}_
\(\require{enclose}\begin{array}{r} _{j}_x+_{k}_ \\[-3pt] x^2+2x+1\enclose{longdiv}{_{j}_x^3 + _{{2*j+k}}_x^2 + _{{j+2*k}}_x+_{{k+l}}_} \\[-3pt] \underline{_{j}_x^3+_{{2*j}}_x^2+_{j}_x}\phantom{2} \\[-3pt] _{k}_x^2+_{{2*k}}_x+_{{l+k}}_ \\[-3pt] \underline{_{k}_x^2+_{{2*k}}_x+_{k}_}\phantom{2} \\[-3pt] _{l}_\end{array}\)
Therefore the remainder obtained _{l}_

content.text:
Divide \(_{j}_x^3 + _{{2*j+k}}_x^2 + _{{j+2*k}}_x+_{{k+l}}_\) by \(x^2+2x+1\)
What is the remainder obtained by the above division.
